summary.para: The SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA structure contains information about a logon session.
This structure is used by the function.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.Size
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.LogonId
member.summary: A locally unique identifier (LUID) that identifies a logon session.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.UserName
member.summary: An structure that contains the account name of the security principal that owns the logon session.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.LogonDomain
member.summary: An structure that contains the name of the domain used to authenticate the owner of the logon session.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.AuthenticationPackage
member.summary: An structure that contains the name of the authentication package used to authenticate the owner of the logon session.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.LogonType
member.summary: A value that identifies the logon method.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.Session
member.summary: A Terminal Services session identifier. This member may be zero.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.Sid
member.summary: A pointer to the user's security identifier (SID).

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.LogonTime
member.summary: The time the session owner logged on.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.LogonServer
member.summary: An structure that contains the name of the server used to authenticate the owner of the logon session.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.DnsDomainName
member.summary: An structure that contains the DNS name for the owner of the logon session.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_SESSION_DATA.Upn
member.summary: An structure that contains the user principal name (UPN) for the owner of the logon session.

summary.para: The user flags for the logon session.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.

listheader.description: The logon is an optimized logon session.
The logon was created for Winlogon.
The Kerberos PKINIT extension was used to authenticate the user in this logon session.
Optimized logon has been disabled for this account.

summary.para: An structure that contains the information on the last logon session.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
An structure that contains the script used for logging on.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
An structure that contains the path to the user's profile.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
An structure that contains the home directory for the logon session.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
An structure that contains the drive location of the home directory of the logon session.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
The time stamp of when the session user logged off.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
The time that the logon session must end.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
The time when the user last changed the password. Note It is up to the Authentication Package to initialize this value and it may not be initialized.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
The password can be changed during the logon session.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
The password must be changed during the logon session.
Windows Server 2003 R2, Windows XP with SP1 and earlier, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This member is not supported.
